articles.headline: Hezbollah Targets Tel Aviv as Israel Moves Forces Toward Lebanon
articles.snippet: A top Israeli military official hinted to soldiers of a possible ground invasion as the United States and France drafted a cease-fire proposal to try to stave off a broader conflict.
articles.abstract: A top Israeli military official hinted to soldiers of a possible ground invasion as the United States and France drafted a cease-fire proposal to try to stave off a broader conflict.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Lebanese militia Hezbollah on Wednesday fired a missile deep into Israel, targeting Tel Aviv for the first time, as the Israeli military called up two brigades of reserve soldiers and sent them north toward the border with Lebanon.
articles.byline: By Liam Stack, Aaron Boxerman, Farnaz Fassihi and Michael Levenson

articles.headline: Vance’s Mother Deals With Her Past and His Future
articles.snippet: In his 2016 memoir, Senator JD Vance of Ohio described a rough childhood owing to his mother’s devastating drug addiction. Today, he and his mother, Beverly Aikins, are a remarkable team.
articles.abstract: In his 2016 memoir, Senator JD Vance of Ohio described a rough childhood owing to his mother’s devastating drug addiction. Today, he and his mother, Beverly Aikins, are a remarkable team.
articles.lead_paragraph: Here is the way JD Vance introduced his mother to the world in his 2016 memoir, “Hillbilly Elegy”:

articles.headline: Hoda Kotb, Cheerful Fixture of NBC’s ‘Today’ Show, Says She Will Depart
articles.snippet: Her exit, planned for early next year, is a seismic shift for NBC and opens up a pair of morning TV’s most coveted anchor chairs.
articles.abstract: Her exit, planned for early next year, is a seismic shift for NBC and opens up a pair of morning TV’s most coveted anchor chairs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hoda Kotb, whose megawatt smile and convivial presence have greeted groggy-eyed viewers of NBC’s “Today” show for the past 17 years, said on Thursday that she would step down from her hosting duties early next year.
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and John Koblin

articles.headline: Southwest Airlines Lays Out Overhaul, and Stock Gains
articles.snippet: The carrier’s move, including service enhancements and share buybacks, came after a hedge fund called for cost savings and better profits.
articles.abstract: The carrier’s move, including service enhancements and share buybacks, came after a hedge fund called for cost savings and better profits.
articles.lead_paragraph: Southwest Airlines announced a three-year plan on Thursday to revitalize its operation and customer offerings as it defends against an activist investor calling for new leadership and a strategy overhaul.

articles.headline: Francis Ford Coppola Re-enters a Changed Hollywood. It Could Be Rough.
articles.snippet: Mr. Coppola has spent $120 million on his new movie, “Megalopolis.” Most box office analysts predict that he’ll get far less in return.
articles.abstract: Mr. Coppola has spent $120 million on his new movie, “Megalopolis.” Most box office analysts predict that he’ll get far less in return.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lionsgate executives say they have done all they can. They’ve booked 1,700 theaters, deployed guerrilla marketers to college campuses and pushed to flip negative reviews to their advantage. They have tied the film’s themes to the presidential race in TV ads.
